concept.title: Custom Profile Variables
concept.shortdesc: Custom profile variables in Test&Target are used by the 1:1 modeling system to offer a crucial way to provide additional data points beyond what the modeling system can determine from the page request.

conbody.p: Any profile attribute passed from an mbox or created in the profile attributes page is automatically included in the 1:1 training data records. Data passed in via the third-party profile API and via mbox parameters from 1:1 display mboxes also contribute to the training data. Segments added to 1:1 campaigns contribute to the training data for that campaign. These methods allow marketers to add data into the system from offline sources, order management systems, and CRM systems.

Marketers can also have a valuable impact on the modeling system by grouping data that the system would otherwise not view as a set. If there are value sets for variables or sets of variables that are known to be valuable for a business, either through offline analysis, data warehouse data, or direct marketing analysis, then these groupings should be saved as profile attributes in Test&Target. These sets can provide valuable information to the model that the model would not collect itself. For example, if a marketing organization considers "luxury loyalists" as people who have purchased more than five times and spent a total of $5,000, then grouping those two data points into a profile attribute or segment means the modeling system considers those two data points as a combined attribute.
